name: Mercure Salzburg City

reviews.title: Average
reviews.text: hotel in a quiet area 15minutes walk from the city centre. The hotel is ok but the rooms have no aircon - a fan is provided which we used 24 hours a day although noisy.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, but a walk to the city
reviews.text: The hotel seems popular with bus trips which fills the restaurant at night - we did not eat at the hotel

reviews.title: Not a great experience
reviews.text: Check in was ok - not friendly or helpful and secure car parking is extra.

reviews.title: nice hotel
reviews.text: This is a typical Mercure with all the amenities you'd expect include tea, coffee, safe, wifi, large comfy bed, clean modern bathroom and so on. Our stay here for 2 nights was pleasant, we had lunch in the restaurant and went to a very highly rated Italian place around the corner. Although Salzburg is a small city this hotel is a little far from the centre of the city which means you'll have to walk up to 10 minutes to and from the hotel. This isn't that bad but given the size of the city you feel an element of being slightly out of the action so to speak. It's close(ish) to the train station which is convenient for travellers using the trains so take that into consideration if you want to book near the station. Overall a good hotel deserving of a 4 out of 5, but not amazing.

reviews.title: Ok hotel outside Salzburg's center
reviews.text: For a 75 euro charge, rooms are not equipped with air-conditioning. Rooms become extremly hot in the evenings in September when I visited the hotel. Very noisy when you keep the windows open. Staff is rude & unhelpful. Was asked to pay 15 euros extra for my 24 month old son, had to show the reservation printout to the staff to convince them he stays free as per hotel policy.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and quiet. It has good in room ammenities. It is within reasonable walking distance to the old town attractions. We were quite pleased with our stay at this hotel.

reviews.title: Good hotel in a very nice city!
reviews.text: Stayed at the Mercure for 4 nights in July, and overall had an enjoyable time. Hotel is at the edge of a residential area, takes about 20 minutes to walk to the old town across the river.The staff were all very nice especially Martin at the front desk. Everyone spoke English very well. Bikes are available from the hotel for 10 euro per day , a good way to see more of the city. Hotel was very clean. The weather was not exactly warm so the lack of air conditioning was not a problem. Parking was available in the hotel's outside lot for free. There are several restaurants within walking distance. The only complaint I would have is the worn out matress, I slept OK but my wife got a bit of a back ache, not sure if it was just our room or they're all like that. As for the noise in the morning, yes if you have the window open you can hear the tour bus starting up, I tend to get up early so not a problem for me. The rate we got was very reasonable so I thought the Mercure Salzburg City was a great choice! And a great city. Enjoy!

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: The Mercure Salzburg City is a good hotel: there are very nice rooms with good beds and bathrooms (just one negative point: there isn't AC). The location is amazing (near of everything) and the breakfats is the best part! The staff speaks a very good english and are helpful.

reviews.title: great american-style hotel alternative to old city hotel
reviews.text: the hotel is located in the "new city" which makes it much more affordable than the hotels in the old city which is where all the salzburg sights are, but as it's only a 7-minute cab ride (less than 10 euros to mozartplatz) it's worth the small inconvenience in terms of the location. i'm surprised at negative reviews regarding the hotel condition itself as it's quite nice and looks much better than it looks in the pictures on this site. it felt a lot like a very good american chain hotel, like marriotts i've stayed in in central washington DC, which is not surprising as apparently they are a large chain that has hotels in many countries. the recent free wi-fi is much appreciated. the room was the biggest i stayed in while in europe and the bed was the plushest and most comfortable. no AC, but easy to open a window and the area is perfectly quiet. the staff at the front desk were polite but not particularly friendly and one woman in particular always seemed busy and somewhat harried in the morning when i asked her to call for a taxi. the only main drawback i have is that the room wasn't well stocked with toilet paper and we actually ran out on our last day, but all in all this was a very nice and affordable alternative to a hotel located in the old city. one last quick tip: although usually the hotel is a short walk from the central train station (10-15 minutes), due to construction on gabelsbergerstrasse the detour will almost double the time it takes walking, so you might want to just take a taxi if you have a lot of luggage.

reviews.title: Location not great
reviews.text: This hotel was fine. The walk into town is not long (10-15 min), but the surrounding neighborhood is not wonderful. There was an electric kettle and tea and coffee in the room, which was nice, but the tea and coffee used was not replaced (and there were no spoons). When I asked about getting more tea, I was sent to the restaurant to get it myself and treated as if my request was unreasonable. I don't mind if they don't want to provide these things for free, but, in that case, don't have the kettle/tea/coffee in the room in the first place. If you do have it, please provide spoons and replace what is used! Otherwise, the stay was fine, the pillows were comfortable and the room was clean.

reviews.title: great location..... but be prepared to walk
reviews.text: lovely place. nice rooms, but need to walk for 5 to 10 mins to mirabelle square, which is like the centre point for everything! free wifi :)))

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: The service was excellent all the time we were in the hotel.

reviews.title: Very good hotel with very good service
reviews.text: We liked the room very much.

reviews.title: Nice place to stay
reviews.text: The location is good. All the amenities were very helpful.

reviews.title: Excellent value at this hotel.
reviews.text: The hotel has very special friendly atmosphere which allowed us to feel just at home! Everything was fine and now we are waiting for a possibility to come back to this hote.

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.text: Very good hotel with moderate rates and not far from the town center

description: This 4 star hotel offers 121 comfortable rooms in the centre of Salzburg, the city of Mozart. Quiet and centrally located, only a few minutes walk from the historic old town. Take the Salzburg North exit from the A1 motorway. Restaurant and bar with terrace, airconditioned meeting rooms and free parking.
